alert.note: Alert for Northwestern Burlington (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 01 at 11:22PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Burlington, east central Montgomery, southeastern Bucks and northeastern Philadelphia Counties through 1145 PM EDT... At 1121 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Ambler, or 10 miles north of Philadelphia, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Philadelphia, Bensalem, Willingboro, Lumberton, Florence, Burlington, Bristol, Mount Holly, Riverside, Hatboro, Ambler, Jenkintown, Bordentown, Beverly, Rockledge, Tullytown, Abington, Langhorne, Bryn Athyn and Ivyland. This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike between exits 5 and 6A. Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 337 and 359. Interstate 95 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 30 and 40. Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 41 and 57. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
